channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Heard on the Street's Stock-Picking Series
item.description: Check out the stocks Heard on the Street writers favor in their eighth annual stock-picking contest.

item.title: The Score: Tesla, Alphabet, JPMorgan Chase and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: JPMorgan Chase Kicks Off Bank Earnings; S&P 500 Hits New High
item.description: The S&P 500 and Dow climbed to new highs, powered by strong earnings results from some of the country’s largest financial institutions.

item.title: We're hiking our Wells Fargo price target after the stock surged on earnings
item.description: Investors instead on the bank running leaner and generating better-than-expected profitability.

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Rises 0.36% This Week to 97.58
item.description: The WSJ Dollar Index gained 0.36% in the week, its second consecutive weekly gain, and was little changed Friday.

item.title: JPMorgan Calls It: The U.S. Economy Has Made a Soft Landing
item.description: The bank reported better-than-expected third-quarter results, a sign that the economy is chugging along as the Fed lowers interest rates.

item.title: We're adding a new Bullpen stock, and it's a financial Cramer has had his eye on
item.description: BlackRock shares surged to a record high Friday after the asset manager posted third quarter earnings that crushed analysts' expectations yet again.

item.title: Wells Fargo shares jump after earnings top Wall Street expectations
item.description: The San Francisco-based lender posted $11.69 billion in net interest income, a 11% decrease from the same quarter last year.

item.title: JPMorgan Chase shares pop 5% after topping estimates on better-than-expected interest income
item.description: JPMorgan said profit fell 2% from a year earlier to $12.9 billion, while revenue climbed 6% to $43.32 billion.

item.title: The Fed is finally cutting rates, but banks aren't in the clear just yet
item.description: When the Federal Reserve cut its benchmark rate by half a percentage point last month, it boosted prospects for many banks.
